alert.note: Alert for Henderson; Transylvania (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 29 at 12:04AM EDT until May 29 at 12:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Carolina... French Broad River At Blantyre affecting Henderson and Transylvania Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...French Broad River At Blantyre. * WHEN...Until this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Minor Flooding continues. Widespread farmland flooding between the French Broad River and the railroad tracks is ongoing. The river may be overtopping the railroad tracks near Fodderstack Mountain Rd. and River Ridge Rd. The intersection of River Rd. and Big Willow Rd. is inundated with several inches of water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:31 PM EDT Saturday the stage was 18.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:31 PM EDT Saturday was 18.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this afternoon and continue falling to 8.9 feet Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.2 feet on 12/02/1996. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For detailed information including observed and forecast stages, flood impacts, flood history, FEMA Flood Hazard Layers, and more, please visit: https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=gsp The next statement should be issued this afternoon before noon EDT.
